job_details.Vacaturetitel: Full stack software engineer - Ecommerce (Shopify Plus / React)
job_details.Functieomschrijving:
Are you our new Fullstack Developer who's not just technically skilled but also practical and business-minded? In this role, you'll lead the technical direction of our Shopify Plus e-commerce platform, combining hands-on development with smart decision-making. Your goal will be to deliver solutions that boost user experience and drive business value. You'll always aim for the fastest, most robust solution that meets our needs, prioritizing what works best for the business. You'll collaborate closely with our small team to ensure our technology supports and advances our business objectives., * E-commerce Development: Lead the development and optimization of our Shopify Plus platform across multiple domains, ensuring a seamless integration with multiple systems and high-performing user experience
     * Lead Development & Team: Write code while managing a small team. Balance hands-on coding with leadership to keep projects on track.
     * Product ownership: Work with team members to prioritize development tasks that align with business goals and deliver real value.
     * Process & Tools: Improve code reliability, CI/CD pipelines, ensure robust QA, and manage code reviews using GitLab/GitHub., * E-commerce: Shopify Plus powers our online store across six domains (JS, HTML, CSS, Liquid), React apps (algolia), GTM server-side + GA4 for analytics
     * ERP: ODOO V16, self-hosted.
     * Data & Cloud: Google Cloud for data lake (bigquery and dataform) and cloud functions
     * Automation & AI: N8N for automation and exploring integrations with Dify for LLM (Large Language Model) capabilities., * Flexible Working: While we prefer candidates in our Eindhoven office, we accept remote candidates, provided you are within a 3-hour time zone of the Netherlands. You'll need to be available during Dutch office hours.
     * High Responsibility & Growth: Enjoy a high level of responsibility and impact, with continuous learning and professional growth opportunities.
     * Team Collaboration: We value collaboration and regularly hold team gatherings, both virtual and in-person, to ensure everyone feels connected and aligned.

   If you're someone who enjoys both the strategic and the practical aspects of development and wants to be part of a small but ambitious team building the future of automated e-commerce, we'd love to hear from you!

Important

   The job requires to be available minimally 32 hours per week, with work scheduled during Dutch office hours. If you apply for a remote position and you're located outside of the Netherlands, you can join us full-time as an independent contractor. To some extent, we ignore geography in order to find the best person for each role. Due to the substantial differences between labor and business laws in each country, the easiest way to hire talent outside of our registered countries is through freelance contracts.
job_details.full_text:
Full stack software engineer - Ecommerce (Shopify Plus / React)

Are you our new Fullstack Developer who's not just technically skilled but also practical and business-minded? In this role, you'll lead the technical direction of our Shopify Plus e-commerce platform, combining hands-on development with smart decision-making. Your goal will be to deliver solutions that boost user experience and drive business value. You'll always aim for the fastest, most robust solution that meets our needs, prioritizing what works best for the business. You'll collaborate closely with our small team to ensure our technology supports and advances our business objectives., * E-commerce Development: Lead the development and optimization of our Shopify Plus platform across multiple domains, ensuring a seamless integration with multiple systems and high-performing user experience
     * Lead Development & Team: Write code while managing a small team. Balance hands-on coding with leadership to keep projects on track.
     * Product ownership: Work with team members to prioritize development tasks that align with business goals and deliver real value.
     * Process & Tools: Improve code reliability, CI/CD pipelines, ensure robust QA, and manage code reviews using GitLab/GitHub., * E-commerce: Shopify Plus powers our online store across six domains (JS, HTML, CSS, Liquid), React apps (algolia), GTM server-side + GA4 for analytics
     * ERP: ODOO V16, self-hosted.
     * Data & Cloud: Google Cloud for data lake (bigquery and dataform) and cloud functions
     * Automation & AI: N8N for automation and exploring integrations with Dify for LLM (Large Language Model) capabilities., * Flexible Working: While we prefer candidates in our Eindhoven office, we accept remote candidates, provided you are within a 3-hour time zone of the Netherlands. You'll need to be available during Dutch office hours.
     * High Responsibility & Growth: Enjoy a high level of responsibility and impact, with continuous learning and professional growth opportunities.
     * Team Collaboration: We value collaboration and regularly hold team gatherings, both virtual and in-person, to ensure everyone feels connected and aligned.

   If you're someone who enjoys both the strategic and the practical aspects of development and wants to be part of a small but ambitious team building the future of automated e-commerce, we'd love to hear from you!

Important

   The job requires to be available minimally 32 hours per week, with work scheduled during Dutch office hours. If you apply for a remote position and you're located outside of the Netherlands, you can join us full-time as an independent contractor. To some extent, we ignore geography in order to find the best person for each role. Due to the substantial differences between labor and business laws in each country, the easiest way to hire talent outside of our registered countries is through freelance contracts.

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses heavily on traditional full-stack e-commerce development using Shopify Plus, React, and related web technologies. While it mentions exploring integrations with Dify for LLM capabilities, this is a minor aspect and not the core focus. The primary responsibilities and technologies listed do not align with the core definitions of ML Engineer or GenAI Engineer, which require deep expertise in model development, training, or advanced generative AI applications. The role is more aligned with traditional software engineering and business-focused e-commerce development, making it 'Ambiguous' according to the provided coding book.

job_tasks.justification: Phrases like 'practical and business-minded', 'deliver solutions that boost user experience and drive business value', 'fastest, most robust solution that meets our needs, prioritizing what works best for the business', 'align with business goals and deliver real value', and 'building the future of automated e-commerce' indicate a strong focus on understanding and aligning technical work with business objectives.
Phrases like 'deliver solutions that boost user experience and drive business value' highlight the need to connect technical work to tangible business outcomes.
job_tasks.phrase: deliver solutions that boost user experience and drive business value

job_tasks.justification: The emphasis on 'prioritizing what works best for the business' shows a clear alignment with business needs over purely technical solutions.
job_tasks.phrase: prioritizing what works best for the business

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'align with business goals and deliver real value' directly links development tasks to strategic business objectives.
job_tasks.phrase: align with business goals and deliver real value

job_tasks.justification: The concluding sentence 'building the future of automated e-commerce' points towards a strategic, business-oriented vision for the role.
job_tasks.phrase: building the future of automated e-commerce

job_tasks.justification: The mention of 'Google Cloud for data lake (bigquery and dataform)' indicates involvement in data infrastructure and processing pipelines.
job_tasks.phrase: Google Cloud for data lake (bigquery and dataform)

job_tasks.justification: The mention of 'exploring integrations with Dify for LLM (Large Language Model) capabilities' suggests an interest in generative modeling, although it's exploratory rather than a core requirement.
job_tasks.phrase: exploring integrations with Dify for LLM (Large Language Model) capabilities

job_tasks.justification: The core of the job description revolves around 'Full stack software engineer - Ecommerce (Shopify Plus / React)', 'Lead the technical direction of our Shopify Plus e-commerce platform', and 'hands-on development'.
job_tasks.phrase: Full stack software engineer - Ecommerce (Shopify Plus / React)

job_tasks.phrase: Lead the development and optimization of our Shopify Plus platform

The mention of 'React apps (algolia)' points to building user-facing applications using specific frameworks.
The mention of 'Google Cloud for data lake (bigquery and dataform) and cloud functions' implies development work on cloud-based services.
job_tasks.phrase: Google Cloud for data lake (bigquery and dataform) and cloud functions

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Improve code reliability, CI/CD pipelines, ensure robust QA' directly relates to operational aspects of software development and deployment.
job_tasks.phrase: Improve code reliability, CI/CD pipelines, ensure robust QA

job_tasks.justification: The mention of 'N8N for automation' suggests involvement in workflow automation and operational processes.
